body_html:
This appears to be a bug in Tensorflow 1.7; when I compiled with TF 1.6, everything worked as expected. The output of tensorflow::OpRegistry::Global()->DebugString(false) is identical, but no error is thrown when loading the model.

TF 1.6 worked on a cut-down version of my model that excluded ListDiff but included Conv2D where TF 1.7 has the same issue as described above. But TF 1.6 still can't find an op kernel for ListDiff even though it's listed in the op registry.
body_text:
This appears to be a bug in Tensorflow 1.7; when I compiled with TF 1.6, everything worked as expected. The output of tensorflow::OpRegistry::Global()->DebugString(false) is identical, but no error is thrown when loading the model.

TF 1.6 worked on a cut-down version of my model that excluded ListDiff but included Conv2D where TF 1.7 has the same issue as described above. But TF 1.6 still can't find an op kernel for ListDiff even though it's listed in the op registry.
body:
> This appears to be a bug in Tensorflow 1.7; when I compiled with TF 1.6, everything worked as expected. The output of tensorflow::OpRegistry::Global()->DebugString(false) is identical, but no error is thrown when loading the model.

TF 1.6 worked on a cut-down version of my model that excluded `ListDiff` but included `Conv2D` where TF 1.7 has the same issue as described above. But TF 1.6 still can't find an op kernel for `ListDiff` even though it's listed in the op registry.
